alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:59AM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River Near Camden affecting Kershaw County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Lexington, Calhoun and Richland Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Kershaw, Fairfield and Lancaster Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Saluda and Newberry Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. At 103.0 feet, Home owners on low lying property have to move belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 102.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EST Saturday was 102.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 102.8 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
